squidpony.squidgrid

Class ConcreteSGTextPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • squidpony.squidgrid.ConcreteSGTextPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, SGDisplay, SGTextDisplay

    public class ConcreteSGTextPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements SGTextDisplay
    This class is a JPanel that will display a text string as a monospaced font regardless of the font's actual spacing. This is accomplished by displaying the text as a graphic.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setText

        public void setText(char[][] chars)
        Description copied from interface: SGTextDisplay
        Sets the contents of the component to reflect the two dimensional character array. Will ignore any portion of the array that is outside the bounds of the component itself. The incoming array must be at least as large in either dimension as the number of rows and columns. The default colors of black foreground and white background will be used.
        Specified by:
        setText in interface SGTextDisplay

      • setBlock

        public void setBlock(int x,
            int y,
            char c)
        Description copied from interface: SGTextDisplay
        Sets one specific block to the given character. This is far more efficient if only a few spots change. refresh() should be called after all changes are made.
        Specified by:
        setBlock in interface SGTextDisplay
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to set
        y - The y coordinate to set
        c - The character to be displayed

      • initialize

        public void initialize(int width,
              int height,
              int rows,
              int columns,
              java.awt.Font font)
        Description copied from interface: SGTextDisplay
        Initializes the component with the supplied values. The cells will be set to the desired width and height and if the size of the font is too large, it will be shrunk until everything fits.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface SGTextDisplay
        Parameters:
        width - The desired width in pixels.
        height - The desired height in pixels.
        rows - The specific number of characters to display horizontally
        columns - The specific number of characters to display vertically
        font - The base font

      • initialize

        public void initialize(int rows,
              int columns,
              java.awt.Font font)
        Description copied from interface: SGTextDisplay
        Initializes the component with the supplied number of rows and columns. The size of the display will be adjusted to match the requested font size as closely as possible.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface SGTextDisplay
        Parameters:
        rows - Number of characters horizontally
        columns - Number of characters vertically
        font - The font to use

      • getComponent

        public java.awt.Component getComponent()
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The Swing Component used to display.

      • ensureFits

        public void ensureFits(char[] characters,
              boolean whiteSpace)
        Description copied from interface: SGTextDisplay
        Resizes the cell dimensions to ensure that all characters will fit within the grid spaces. If whiteSpace is true, then every character is guaranteed to have at least one pixel between it and the edge of the cell. If false, some characters might sit against the edge of the cell, but will not be cropped. This method does not force a redisplay of the grid.
        Specified by:
        ensureFits in interface SGTextDisplay

      • willFit

        public boolean willFit(char character,
              boolean whiteSpace)
        Description copied from interface: SGTextDisplay
        Test if the given character will fit in the current cell dimension using the current Font. If whiteSpace is true then will test if the character will have at least one pixel between it and the edge of the cell. If false, will only check for strictly in the cell with no regard for whitespace.
        Specified by:
        willFit in interface SGTextDisplay
        Returns:
        true if it will fit, false otherwise.
